ys.succinct.util

Interface BitSet

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BitVector
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntBitSet, IntRank, SamplingBitVector

    public interface BitSet
    An object that represents a set of bits and allows read/write operations on them. It can handle up to Integer.MAX_VALUE bits.
    Author:
    Yauheni Shahun

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean get(int index)
      Gets the bit value at the given position.
      void set(int index, boolean value)
      Sets the bit value at the given position.
      int size()
      Returns the number of bits in the bit set.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        boolean get(int index)
        Gets the bit value at the given position.
        Parameters:
        index - the 0-based index of the bit
        Returns:
        true if the bit is set to 1, or false if it's set to 0
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the bit set

      • set

        void set(int index,
       boolean value)
        Sets the bit value at the given position.
        Parameters:
        index - the 0-based index of the bit
        value - the boolean value that indicates 1 if it's true and 0 otherwise
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the bit set

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the number of bits in the bit set.
